Illegal fishing endangers wildlife and fish stocks.

In East Anglia alone, our officers seized 52 illegal nets and traps between March and December last year.

If you see an illegal net or trap let us know by calling 0800 807060.

More info: https://t.co/LXS1yx3Qnm https://t.co/Rqr8TT3zrz

tweets.text: @No1EstateBoss @CLAtweets @Ruralpay @NorthumbrianH2O @ForestryComm @EnvAgency @DefraFAS @JanetHughes Thank YOU Janet - super clear and informative presentation (and answering a wide variety of questions) - inspires confidence and reassurance in equal measure.

We are delighted that @johncurtinEA will be joining us at #GAConf21 to talk about flooding in England in the past, present and future. Suitable for #geographyteachers at all Key Stages. https://t.co/J5yjSj8ecq Book now!

Thank you @CLAtweets @CLANorth for organising a great update. Thank you to all of speakers for your time @Ruralpay 🌾@NorthumbrianH2O 💦@ForestryComm 🌳@EnvAgency 🚰 @DefraFAS 🐂🐏🐖@JanetHughes ⭐️ https://t.co/3QlePfV5Ls

Are Beavers better for flood alleviation than man made leaky dams? Good to see an experiment to find out @spainshall in Essex (lots more other wildlife in the Beaver works compared with human engineering). We even got to see a Beaver (think big Spaniel, rather than Guinea Pig!) https://t.co/QT6zwSK0JC

Do you like Great Crested Newts?! 🦎 do you like ponds and are you in north #yorkshire?  If yes, would you like @YorksWildlife to install #GCN pond habitat in your park, garden or land for FREE?? If you’re interested please pm new for more details. @NewtPartnership https://t.co/MudCc8PCFS

@JanetHughes smashing it out the park today... (and pleased I was your favourite question!) • it’s all of our jobs to share info, support, encourage, educate, connect people and feedback what is working and what maybe could work better... https://t.co/N2BGdN094B
one of Uxbridge's ancient ponds, all stick-willow'd bayou and wagtail haven @WildLondon @Hillingdon @ColneCAN @EnvAgencySE #WorldWetlandsDay @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/1IPhegmTpF

Explore how #Flood impacts #community in the new Landscapes to Lifescapes digital exhibition https://t.co/INaLWYhkMC @TheFloodHub @CwllCFloodForum @CIWEM @EnvAgencySW @floodandcoast @BeFloodReady @CornwallCouncil https://t.co/ceILc4NRt8

"Creating a better place for people and wildlife" is the strap line on @EnvAgency headed note paper. How does this statement fit with sewage discharges into the @RiverChess  on 89 days over the past 18 months. That is 16% of the time being exceptional, really?????

Flooding has a devastating impact on  people. So social research is really important. Here is the new #Landscapes2Lifescapes on-line exhibition on how flooding can affect us all at any age. @LancasterUni @UniOfHull @EnvAgency @ESRC https://t.co/hndczjPP1G

Busy week for all our staff, keeping floodwaters at bay for communities all over England...

... and this is what we have been up to in the South East...
#floodaware https://t.co/H5MiPb4uXn https://t.co/rgd9XjdvDS

urls.title: Enforcement partnership nets dishonest game angler a conviction for illegally fishing on the River Exe - Angling Trust
urls.description: A game angler reported three times by a volunteer bailiff for fishing illegally has been ordered to pay fines and costs totalling £419 and had his fishing tackle confiscated and destroyed. James Robert Lee, from Devon, appeared at Exeter Magistrates Court to face three charges of unlawfully attempting to take fish contrary to schedule […]

tweets.text: A game angler has been convicted of fishing illegally following great partnership work involving an Angling Trust Volunteer Bailiff in support of @DCPoliceRural_D, @DC_Police and @DCFishEA – Always make sure you have a valid @EnvAgency fishing licence - https://t.co/Tm1oL5iWjG

The Joint Unit for #WasteCrime continues to crack down on criminals dumping waste illegally.

Recently, their investigations in the Midlands discovered waste illegally buried, which also posed a risk to the local environment.

Arrests were made and investigations continue. https://t.co/gj36MNph1w

urls.title: Learning | The Flood Hub
urls.description: Welcome to the Learning area where you can find information on our Education Package which is launching in early 2021 and the Landscapes to Lifescapes Digital Exhibition.

tweets.text: @VictoriaMurray3 @YorksWildlife @NewtPartnership @Fr_RowntreePark @northyorkmoors @RyedaleDC @ScarboroCouncil @RaincliffeWoods @YorkCountyParks @DalbyFriends @StNicksFields @EnvAgencyYNE Is this only for North Yorkshire or can bits of Leeds (Wetherby & villages around) get involved too?

Yes almost the moment water levels get to a respectable level we get to see a chalk stream that is until the sewage discharges start. A fleeting glimpse then it's gone. @EnvAgency https://t.co/HNHGAiNBV4

@Parrog3 @PJennings88 @EnvAgency @RiverChess @OliverHealdUK @AquiferChalk @AffinityWater @NorthHertsDC An abundance of water now demonstrates how the chalk streams were pre abstraction. This is how they should be. Come on EA stop the sewage and keep the water where it should be @PJennings88 @AquiferChalk @EnvAgency

@VictoriaMurray3 @YorksWildlife @NewtPartnership @northyorkmoors @RyedaleDC @ScarboroCouncil @RaincliffeWoods @YorkCountyParks @DalbyFriends @StNicksFields @EnvAgencyYNE We are DEFINITELY interested. Our volunteers are trying to develop new wildlife habitat areas in Rowntree Park in York. How do we get in touch? Can’t seem to DM you. 💕

@VictoriaMurray3 @YorksWildlife @NewtPartnership @Fr_RowntreePark @northyorkmoors @RyedaleDC @ScarboroCouncil @RaincliffeWoods @YorkCountyParks @DalbyFriends @StNicksFields @EnvAgencyYNE Think we have a good potential pond site in Masham, North Yorkshire and would love to be involved. We're also working with local school (once lockdown ends) so it would be great to have them involved in some way.

urls.title: New flood defence gates for Port of Tilbury in £34 million scheme
urls.description: Construction work has started on an innovative scheme to improve Tilbury’s flood defences with the installation of new dual function flood lock gates.

tweets.text:
Major construction work has started to install new dual-function flood lock gates at #ThePortofTilbury.

The innovative #FloodDefence system will safeguard thousands of local homes and businesses.

Read more here ⬇️
https://t.co/v64xHbRlJK

In light of recent incidents we would like to advise swimmers that the River should not be used in dangerous conditions ,when either red or yellow stream warnings are displayed. During these conditions dangerous currents and debris will make this activity particularly hazardous .
Always good to see @EnvAgency and others using @GeodesignB temporary #flood barrier to help protecting communities against #flooding . #floodaware https://t.co/EzSxWDbmAr
@SupportUKMfg @EnvAgencyMids Congratulations 👍🏆

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency I see no praise for how your are dealing with the most complained about landfill site Walley’s Quarry in Newcastle under Lyme? When will you act? How many complaints do you need to abate this nuisance to the residents? @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL #capitoff
